title: [3 YoE, Unemployed, Graphic Designer, United Kingdom]
text:
Rahul Dennison
Leeds,England ▪  Have the right to work in the UK

Creative and results-driven professional with over three years of experience in graphic design, branding, and marketing communications. Holding an MSc in Marketing from Northbridge University and a BA in Graphic Design, I combine artistic creativity with analytical and strategic thinking to deliver impactful campaigns. My work bridges design and marketing, transforming insights and data into engaging, consumer-focused visuals that communicate with clarity and purpose. Passionate about storytelling, inclusion, and visual innovation, I craft designs that not only look beautiful but also build meaningful connections and deliver measurable results. Recognised for a strategic mindset, strong problem-solving skills, and meticulous attention to detail. Fluent in English and Spanish, with working knowledge of German and Italian, enabling effective collaboration in multicultural teams.

## Competencies
Branding & Visual Identity · Digital & Print Design · Motion Graphics · Storytelling & Narrative Design · Strategic Digital Marketing · Content Creation · Project Planning & Delivery · Social Media Management · Brand Engagement · Research & Evaluation · Analytical Reasoning · Reporting & Presenting · Cross-Team Collaboration · Client Relations · Critical & Creative Thinking · Attention to Detail · Organisation & Prioritisation

## Technical Skills
Adobe Creative Cloud · Adobe Lightroom · Adobe Photoshop · Adobe PremierePro · Adobe AfterEffects · Adobe InDesign · Adobe Illustrator · Figma · Canva · WordPress · Visual Studio Code · Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Teams) · Social Media · HTML(Basic) · Pantone Matching · Colour Proofing · Print Production & Finishing

## Career Summary

Social Media Officer - Hartwell University                                                                 January 2025 - September 2025
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
• Enhanced student engagement by approximately 50% through creative digital campaigns and inclusive communication initiatives.
• Produced cohesive visual content and campaign materials that reinforced the Board’s mission to enrich the postgraduate experience.
• Spearheaded the introduction of a new digital platform consolidating resources, events, and support networks for international students.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Developed and coordinated marketing and social media campaigns following audience analysis and engagement data.
• Created event visuals and communication assets aligned with the university’s identity guidelines.
• Advocated for student needs during Board meetings, contributing to policy improvement.

Audiovisual Designer Assistant - Luminex Studio • England                                                  January 2024 - July 2024
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
• Led the brand transition and rebranding campaign, designing a complete visual identity system including colour palettes, typography, digital assets, print materials, and merchandising.
• Produced over 20 motion graphics pieces (manuals, explainer videos, and animated content).
• Directed the product relaunch campaign, overseeing photography, videos, and printed assets such as bus banners and promotional posters.
• Earned formal commendation from the CEO for exceptional performance and creative leadership.
• Leveraged data-driven findings to drive wide-scale areas of improvement within content creation, resulting in a notable increase in online engagement.
• Honed an environment of transparency and collaboration among fellow marketers and graphic designers to promote creative and critical thinking practices.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Accountable for all internal and external graphic and audiovisual design, from concept to delivery, such as animated manuals, produced videos, and printed pieces.
• Collaborated with senior executives (VP, CEO) to present and implement creative strategies.
• Maintained company social media platforms by distributing high-impact photo and video content based on weekly posting schedules. Captured and edited large amounts of images on a daily basis for future use.
• Liaised with representatives from Digital and Trade Marketing, Product Design, HR, Sales, Account Management and Logistics teams to enable a free flow of ideas and mutual understanding.
• Brainstormed data-driven ideas with other teams to help in team ideation.
• Oversaw printing processes, conducted colour and quality checks, and managed suppliers.

Graphic Designer - Freelance                                                                             November 2022 - December 2023
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
• Delivered end-to-end design projects for multiple clients, including branding, social media campaigns, and editorial materials.
• Recognised by clients for versatility, creativity, and meeting tight deadlines.
• Supported businesses with visually consistent, audience-focused marketing materials.
• Stayed updated on latest design techniques and best practices, as well as digital media trends, by engaging in constant research.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Managed projects from brief to delivery, ensuring alignment with client goals and brand identity.
• Produced creative assets for print and digital platforms.
• Produced frequent progress updates to maintain client expectation, and organised meetings with customer representatives to gather distinct needs and requests prior to the delivery of tailored, innovative solutions.
• Applied accessibility principles and storytelling to enhance engagement and inclusivity.

## Education

MSc Marketing - Northbridge University - England                                                          2024 - 2025
• Recipient of “Northbridge Excellence Scholarship” and “Marketing Futures Scholarship”
• Modules: Consumer Behaviour, Marketing Society and Insights, Markets and Strategy, Building Marketing Intelligence, and Marketing Communications

BA Graphic Design (First Class Honours equivalent) - Ravenshire Institute of Design                        2017 - 2022
• Participant in University’s Top Design Projects Exhibitions in 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022
• Modules: Branding & Visual Identity, Editorial & Print Design, Digital Media Design, UX/UI, Typography, Colour Theory, Photography, Advertising & Communication Strategy, Packaging Design and Inclusion & accessibility through art and design.

## Professional Development
• The Global Standard in Digital Marketing Certification, Digital Marketing Institute (Ongoing)
• DIGITAL MARKSTRAT Business Simulation, Strata Simulations (2025)

## Volunteer Work
• SilverOak Community Centre (2022 – 2024) - Planned and supported community-focused events for a wide range of elderly residents by organising team members and promoting sustainable practices
• BrightPath Learning (2023 – 2024) - Created interesting and dynamic English lesson plans for underprivileged children, fostering an inclusive environment for diverse social and cultural backgrounds

## Portfolio and Projects
LINK : Digital and print design · Illustration and editorial design · Email and social media graphics · Web banners and visual campaigns · Animation and video editing · Visual storytelling · Branding and identity projects · Fashion-inspired creative direction
